abstract: Songbird Estates, the controller of the Canary Wharf financial district in London, is planning to sell 895 million pounds in shares to repay a Citigroup loan and to finance projects, the chairman of the property company said Thursday.
snippet: Songbird Estates, the controller of the Canary Wharf financial district in London, is planning to sell 895 million pounds in shares to repay a Citigroup loan and to finance projects, the chairman of the property company said Thursday.
lead_paragraph: Songbird Estates, the controller of the Canary Wharf financial district in London, is planning to sell £895 million in shares to repay a Citigroup loan and to finance projects, the chairman of the property company said Thursday.

headline.main: Canary Wharf Owner Sets Share Sale
